result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon Emerson Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF581 and 15CM757:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Devon Emerson Bryant appeared. Case called at 4:23 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a final pre trial conference. There is a resolution. Atty Petros recites agreement. ADA Nieskes states victims rights have been complied with.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 2 Battery   in 15CF581 and GUILTY to Ct.1 Resisting or Obstructing in 15CM757 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 Battery in 15CF581 and Ct.1 Resiting or Obstructing in 15CM757. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 1, 3 and 4  in 15CF581. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal. DE makes statement. 

Crt orders:
15CF581 Ct. 2 Battery:
- 67 days jail. 67 days credit. TIME SERVED
- Court costs of $243.00 and DNA Surcharge $200.00. Bond to apply. Set up payment plan on remaining amount owed.
- DNA Sample

15CM757 Ct. 1 Resisting or Obstructing:
- 67 days jail. 67 days credit. TIME SERVED. Run Concurrent to 15CF581
- Court costs of $243.00 and DNA Surcharge of $200.00
- DNA Sample
Final pre-trial on May 5, 2016 at 04:15 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Rohan. ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Devon Emerson Bryant appeared from jail. Case called at 2:39 pm. Includes 15CM757, 15CT115 and 15CF581. In 15CF581: Atty. Petros states DE wishes to Waive Preliminary Hearing. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Atty Petros. hml

INCLUDES 15CF581 and 15CM757

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Marquita S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY: Joseph Caton,  DF:  Devon Emerson Bryant appeared from jail via video.
